General Rules:

1. You must follow all sitewide rules at all times.
2. Purple is my color. Please do not use it.
3. You may not discuss this game anywhere outside of this game thread unless your role PM gives you permission to do so.
4. You may not directly quote anything from me or any co-mod. Quoting from private threads is also strictly prohibited. Paraphrasing is allowed.
5. There will be NO bullying, personal insults or attacks.
6. Don’t pretend to break the rules. I consider that actually breaking them.
7. I reserve the right to add, remove or modify rules at any time.
8. If you think I’ve forgotten something, please let me know immediately by @mod: in thread or PMing me.

Voting and Lynches:

9. Please use vote tags or bolded votes like VOTE: UpTooLate or VOTE: UpTooLate to place your vote.
10. Votes must be at the beginning of a line to be counted.
11. A lynch is achieved when 50%+1 of votes are cast for the same player.
12. If you would prefer not to lynch, you may vote for a No Lynch. This requires the same number of votes as a regular lynch.
13. Once you have been killed, you may not post in thread for the remainder of the game, however you may continue conversation during twilight until I lock the thread.

Activity and Deadlines:

14. Each day phase will last 2 weeks.
15. Each night phase will last 48 hours.
16. Deadlines may be extended for extenuating circumstances.
17. Night actions must be submitted to me by PM before the 48 hour deadline is up. Those with PTs may bold their actions in assigned PT before the deadline as well. If you fail to submit your action before the deadline, you will default to “no action.”
18. Players will receive a prod PM after 48 hours without posting (72 hours on weekends). Prods will be announced in thread.
19. Players who do not respond to a prod within 24 hours or have to be prodded more than twice will be force replaced.
20. Please let me know in thread or via PM if you need to take V/LA. Players on V/LA will be announced in thread.


Spoiler: At least one player will receive the following role PM:
Welcome to Puppy Mafia, XXXXX! You are a Vanilla Townie!
Abilities: You may vote during the day!
You win when: All threats are eliminated to the town and at least one town member is still alive.
10/13 Players have confirmed and Day 1 begins!

I think there's a fundamental difference in the way that town players and scum players approach rvs, which manifests itself in two ways. First, I believe that arguments that arise out of RVS are easily readable through the lens of "is this player attempting to discover alignment" or "is this player attempting to win the argument" town players tend to do the former, scum the latter. Second, I think that scum posts tend to try to keep the day random as long as possible, whereas town tend to jump right in and try to dig as far into what little information they have. This one is a little less reliable than the former for finding scum players because town players tend to play like crap and enjoy being random and posting meaningless injokey crap that mires the thread down in randomness for pages and pages and allows the scum get away with doing the same, but its pretty good as a way to see which players are approaching the early game in a town way. I think your post fits these two patterns pretty well, so I'm pretty confident in you as town.

I want to expand on this because I was thinking about it while I was afk for the past few minutes...

I think town in general are more likely to use self-meta as a defense because it's frustrating as town to be accused of something that you know you would never do. Scum in some cases might also use self-meta as a defense if they're intentionally subverting their own meta or if their meta has recently changed, but it's probably less common.

What makes Dunnstral's post uncomfortable is that it leaves self-meta as the logical leap between what he said and what he meant - in order for his post to be meaningful, one must mentally add the statement "Dunnstral would probably not be that gutsy as mafia." Dunnstral's post is phrased in such a way that it's supposedly referring to a more global meta, which makes it easy to mentally add the appropriate logical leap without realizing that one is attributing anything specifically to Dunnstral's meta. I'm not confident that the post is a scum tell, but it's....sleazy, in a way. I think that whether or not it's a scum tell depends on how likely town would be to actually vocalize the leap to self-meta when posting that kind of a thought. I'm currently leaning towards it being something that one would be reasonably likely to point out explicitly if they felt like it applies to them.
